channel.title: What site supports ELGG?
channel.description:
ELGG, is a free, open-source social site software. I want to set it up, but I can't seem to get it to work on 000webhost, or on my wamp server. Anyone know a site that could support it, or know how to local host it?
[url=http://elgg.org/]Elgg website[/url]

item.title: What site supports ELGG?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Team_Rocket, post:13, topic:477642”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=595839.msg4195603#msg4195603 date=1357446458]

I talked to their support

Just so you know, you can’t truly rely upon Website Support.

I don’t know how else I’d find out about it…

Hello,

I am sorry for delay in responding to your request.
The PHP open_basedir feature is enabled by default and can not be disabled for security reasons. However, it can be done with premium account. You can upgrade your account at http://www.000webhost.com/upgrade/

Many Thanks,
Thorsten | http://www.free-installations.info

Volunteer Staff
www.000webhost.com

[/quote]

I love the response which tells you about ‘Premium’ Status. What have we learned today?[/quote]
I did say that in my original post about that.

Read full topic

item.title: What site supports ELGG?
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:9, topic:477642”]I’ve got this in httpd.conf:

<Directory "c:/wamp/www/SnS/"> AllowOverride All </Directory>
It’s showing the same error as before[/quote]

Try this:

<Directory /www/SnS> AllowOverride All </Directory>

Read full topic

item.title: What site supports ELGG?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

I’ve got this in httpd.conf:

<Directory "c:/wamp/www/SnS/"> AllowOverride All </Directory>
It’s showing the same error as before

Read full topic

item.title: What site supports ELGG?
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:7, topic:477642”]Okay, so elgg is in www/SnS/
On wamp that’s 127.0.0.1/SnS.
Is this good?

<Directory Http://127.0.0.1/SnS/> AllowOverride All </Directoy>[/quote]

It is not a URL, please look at the format I provided above. There should be no http:// in front of it, or the IP address. It is a directory structure it wants.

PS: Read my last post. I made a slight mistake.

Read full topic

item.title: What site supports ELGG?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Okay, so elgg is in www/SnS/
On wamp that’s 127.0.0.1/SnS.
Is this good?

<Directory Http://127.0.0.1/SnS/> AllowOverride All </Directoy>
EDIT:
I did that and it gave me a 500 Internal Server Error.

Read full topic

item.title: What site supports ELGG?
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

This ELGG thing looks like quite the pain in the ass to setup.

Create a .htaccess file in the directory you’re trying to install ELGG and in it put: wat
Sorry, I mean put this in your httpd.conf file:

<Directory PATH_TO_DIR> AllowOverride All </Directory>

Make sure you change PATH_TO_DIR to the absolute path to the directory. An example is something like,

/home/user/public_html/elgg

Basically AllowOverride allows Apache to read and execute instructions from .htaccess which can potentially override the settings in the httpd.conf file.

(That Apache book from the library seems to be useful after all!)

Read full topic

item.title: What site supports ELGG?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Ecko, post:2, topic:477642”]http://elgg.org/requirements.php

Any host that meets these requirements. Make sure they are not running PHP as CGI (suPHP). They have a few compatible hosts here:

http://elgg.org/hosting.php[/quote]
000webhost doesn’t. I talked to their support and they have one of the features elgg needs shut off for “security reasons” but if I upgrade I can change it…
Edit: they only have 1 host and it’s a paid host

Read full topic

http://elgg.org/requirements.php

Any host that meets these requirements. Make sure they are not running PHP as CGI (suPHP). They have a few compatible hosts here:

http://elgg.org/hosting.php
